Failure Scenario: Failure of 1 TMS Central Control Unit (CCU)
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Exit at Terminus Station

Failure Scenario: Loss of 1 or 2 out of 4 Traction Control Unit
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Removal at End of Single Trip depending on the speed. Reduces to 25kph, immediate removal

Failure Scenario: Failure of Primary or Secondary Suspension
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢Train already in service: Immediate Train Withdrawal from service.

Failure Scenario: Failure of 1 Current Collector Shoe on 1 car on 1 side
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Removal at End of Single Trip (to onboard)
Local Response: Qualified train driver to verify the fault at the next station upon receiving the alarm

Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Immediate Train Withdrawal from service.
Local Response:
i. Single red APS alarm â€“Reset APS. If unsuccessful, immediate train removal . 
ii. Both APS Failure- Reset APS.If unsuccesful, immediate train removal.

Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Exit at Terminus Station

Failure Scenario: Failure of 2 Current Collector Shoes on 1 car on 1 side
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Immediate Train Withdrawal from service
â€¢ Note: Deploy qualified Train driver to verify the fault at the next station upon receiving the alarm

Failure Scenario: Two doors fails to open or close per car side
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢Train already in service: Isolate the failed doors (in closed positions) and withdraw the Train from service at the End of the round Trip

â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service.
â€¢Train already in service: Remove the obstacle before continuing Train service

â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service.
â€¢Train already in service remain in service until the End of round Trip only if qualified Train driver is deployed on board. 
â€¢Note: VATO holds the Train in the next Station. OCC can verify via CCTV and may release the train.
Local Response: Field staff to check and verify the alarm, reset fire alarm if require.

Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service.
â€¢Train already in service Exit at Terminus station
Local Response: Field staff to check and verify the alarm, reset fire alarm if require.

Failure Scenario: Failure of 1 Current Collector Shoe on 1 car on 1 side
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Removal at End of Single Trip (to onboard)
Local Response: Qualified train driver to verify the fault at the next station upon receiving the alarm

Failure Scenario: Loss of DC Power by Train
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢ Train already in service: Immediate Train Withdrawal from service
â€¢ Note: Permanent Loss of 750VDC onboard train due to Train fault. Rescue Train may be required
Local Response: Qualified train driver verify the alarm, train withdrawal at terminus station

Failure Scenario: Failure of Single Multifunction Vehicle Bus (MVB) Network
Guideline for Chief Controller:
â€¢ Train Entering service: Not allowed to enter service
â€¢Train already in service: Immediate Train Withdrawal from service
â€¢Note: Rescue Train may be required
Local Response: Check on HMI and identify which equipment causing alarm appear and reset if possible
